medley.util

Class Frequency

  • java.lang.Object
    • medley.util.Frequency

  • public final class Frequency
extends Object
    Frequency class that contains methods that should be used to manipulate frequencies.
    Author:
    Salvatore Gentile

    • Method Detail

      • getFrequency

        public static double getFrequency(int semitonesDistance)
        Returns the frequency of the note which is distant the specified number of semitones from the international standard pitch A440 pitch.

        The frequency is computed using getFrequency method.

        Parameters:
        semitonesDistance - a specified number of half steps between a Note and the A4 note.
        Returns:
        the frequency of the note which is distant the specified number of semitones from the international standard pitch A440 pitch.
        See Also:
        getFrequency(int semitonesDistance, double pitch)

      • getFrequency

        public static double getFrequency(int semitonesDistance,
                                  double pitch)
        Returns the frequency of the note which is distant the specified number of semitones from the specified pitch.

        The frequency is computed using the following formula: $$ f = 2^\frac{n}{12} \cdot p $$ where \( n \) is the distance in semitones, and \( p \) a pitch.

        Parameters:
        semitonesDistance - a specified number of half steps between a Note and the A4 note.
        pitch - a specified pitch.
        Returns:
        the frequency of the note which is distant the specified number of semitones from the specified pitch.

      • getCents

        public static double getCents(double reference,
                              double frequency)
        Returns the number of cents between a reference frequency and a specified frequency.

        The number of cents are computed using the following formula: $$ n = 1200 \cdot log_2 \left( \frac{b}{a} \right) $$ where \( a \) is the reference frequency, and \( b \) the specified frequency.

        Parameters:
        reference - a reference frequency.
        frequency - a specified frequency.
        Returns:
        the number of cents between a reference frequency and a specified frequency.

      • getSemitones

        public static int getSemitones(double reference,
                               double frequency)
        Returns the number of semitones between a reference frequency and a specified frequency.

        The number of semitones are computed using getSemitones method, whose argument is computed using the getCents method.

        Parameters:
        reference - a reference frequency.
        frequency - a specified frequency.
        Returns:
        the number of semitones between a reference frequency and a specified frequency.
        See Also:
        getSemitones(double cents), getCents(double reference, double frequency)

      • getSemitones

        public static int getSemitones(double cents)
        Returns the number of semitones corresponding to the specified number of cents.
        Parameters:
        cents - a specified number of cents.
        Returns:
        the number of semitones corresponding to the specified number of cents.

      • getMIDINumber

        public static int getMIDINumber(double frequency)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the MIDI note number corresponding to the specified frequency.

        The MIDI note number is computed using the following formula: $$ d = 69 + 12 \cdot \log_{2} \left( \frac{f}{440} \right) $$ where \( f \) is a valid frequency.

        Parameters:
        frequency - a specified frequency.
        Returns:
        the MIDI note number corresponding to the specified frequency.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frequency < 8.176 or frequency > 12543.854
        See Also:
        Validator.frequency(double frequency, double min, double max)

      • getMIDINumberFrequency

        public static double getMIDINumberFrequency(int midiNumber)
                                     throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the MIDI note number corresponding to the specified frequency.

        The frequency is computed using the following formula: $$ f = 2^\frac{d - 69}{12} \cdot 440 $$ where \( d \) is a valid MIDI note number.

        Parameters:
        midiNumber - a specified MIDI note number.
        Returns:
        the frequency corresponding to the specified MIDI note number.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if midiNumber < 0 or midiNumber > 127
        See Also:
        Validator.midiNumber(int midiNumber)

      • getPianoKeyNumber

        public static int getPianoKeyNumber(double frequency)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the piano key number corresponding to the specified frequency.

        The piano key number is computed using the following formula: $$ n = 12 \cdot log_2 \left( \frac{f}{440} \right) $$ where \( f \) is a valid frequency.

        Parameters:
        frequency - a specified frequency.
        Returns:
        the piano key number corresponding to the specified frequency.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if frequency < 27.500 or frequency > 4186.009
        See Also:
        Validator.frequency(double frequency, double min, double max)

      • getPianoKeyFrequency

        public static double getPianoKeyFrequency(int pianoKey)
                                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the frequency corresponding to the specified piano key number.

        The frequency is computed using the following formula: $$ f(n) = \left( \sqrt[12]{2} \right)^{n - 49} \cdot 440 $$ or, alternatively: $$ f(n) = 2^\frac{n - 49}{12} \cdot 440 $$ where \( n \) is a valid piano key number.

        Parameters:
        pianoKey - a specified piano key number.
        Returns:
        the frequency corresponding to the specified piano key number.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pianoKey < 1 or pianoKey > 88
        See Also:
        Validator.pianoKey(int pianoKey)
